name: InterContinental Boston

reviews.text: Advertised as a 5 star hotel but it isn't - it's a solid 4 star. For example there were no slippers in the room, only one robe for two people (a second was requested but taken away by the cleaning staff the next day), the rooms were cleaned well enough but not really left looking finished, no evening turn down, etc. In addition, some of the staff on the front desk seemed very disinterested and couldn't always answer basic questions about the hotel and we had to call our own taxi one evening as there was no one out front.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: On the plus side, the gym, pool and spa are all nice and there was no problem getting spa appointments. The rooms were big, although not very well sound proofed and a little too warm even though we put the air condititioning on maximun, but to be fair it was 30+ outside so maybe there was a lot of pressure on the system.
reviews.title: Great room with hotwire price!!

reviews.text: The location was good and for what we paid it was not bad value so if you get a good deal this hotel is worth visiting. But if you want 5 star luxuary it's not the place!
reviews.title: Fine - if you don't have a room near the ice machine

reviews.text: Myself and 3 friends recently stayed here for an evening. Valet me us out front and took the car to park. Check in was smooth and the room was good size. I booked this trip on Hotwire so it was only 170.00 a night and for downtown Boston I was impressed. I do not know if it is a 5 star because I never really felt that wow this place is exceptional but that being said its for sure a 4 star. The bathrooms are gigantic. A tub that is seperate from a large ( room for 2 ) stand up glass shower. The staff seemed friendly what limited contact we had with them. The only down side of the stay was the fire alarm at 4:15 am which I guess unless they pulled it intentially there is nothing they can do about that . I would stay here again for sure and would recommend going through Hotwire to get a room. Hope this helped some of you!!!
reviews.title: Run, don't walk, away from the InterContinental Boston

likes.liked: — close to the BCEC conference center, quiet area, good restaurant suggestions
likes.disliked: — rude management, hotel nickel and dimes you to death, dirty rooms, location far away from everything

reviews.text: I stayed at the Intercontinental for a week in August and overall I would say that the hotel is fine. Though there were two things :

I stayed here for one night in January with my mother. We had a superb time. Every employee was extremely cordial and helpful. We booked the cheapest 2-bed room. The room was big and the beds & linens extremely comfortable. The windows were huge but overlooked an alley-way (fine since we didn't care about a view) The bathroom was wonderful - both a bathtub and a glass-enclosed shower (with a very handy shelf) It was extremely quiet both during the day and the night (in fact, even though it was a Saturday night, it seemed almost empty - very peaceful!)
reviews.title: Perfect for our stay

reviews.text: The gym had a lovely view and a cool locker room with electronic lockers and a steam room. The pool was also great and deserted whenever we went there. Plenty big for swimming laps.
reviews.title: Top shelf

reviews.text: The restaurant served a delicious dinner and breakfast. The pastries with the continental breakfast were delectable and the unlimited fresh-squeezed orange juice was great.
reviews.title: Good service; a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is also a nice bar that sort of spills into the lobby - lots of comfy chairs and couches and a little fireplace; good and interesting cocktails, not ludicrously overpriced.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The location is superclose to South Station and 5 min from Boston Common. I LOVED this hotel! The price (ours included breakfast) was great for a January weekend - worth a splurge if you normally stay at cheaper places.
reviews.title: Love this Hotel!

reviews.text: I am a single, woman of color, in my late 40's, who has been wanting to visit Boston since being of grade-school age. My friend and I got an unbelievable 3 night-four day rate on this hotel which included airfare, for less than what some have shared that they have paid for a two night stay in this hotel!! I made a decision to spend more time out of my room than in it, but know that this hotel is perfect for those who are looking for a relaxing weekend as well!!
reviews.title: Perfect Place for a Chick Trip for Women of Color

likes.liked: — the value for the price I pade; I got a deal!!!
likes.disliked: — I wish there had been an on-site restaurant that was not as upscale but I am not sure that's possible considering the star rating of this hotel.

reviews.text: The Positives:
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, not a single problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The hotel's location is great, but only if you are able to do the kind of walking that's associated with big cities like New York and D.C.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. We were able to catch a bus from the airport to the hotel for the equivalent of two dollars each. A cab would have been a total of $20 for the two of us. We decided to buy a transit pass good for a week which cost $15; a day pass was $9.00. The transit station is a five-ten minute walk from the hotel. My suitcase weighed almost 50 pounds; yet I was able to make it!!
reviews.title: overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. The security in this hotel is unbelievable!!! The hotel security were men in suits who "patroled" the lobby area, opened doors for us, and greeted us whenever we encountered them in the lobby on our way in and out of the hotel. I felt safe as a single woman in this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very nice time at the Intercontinental. We were there mid-week and did the tourist thing. We walked the Freedom Trail, took the ferry back to Long Wharf and were happy to discover we were only 3 blocks from the hotel. The hotel was very clean with modern touches. Our room was very nice (on the 5th floor, back side). My only real complaint was the bathroom. It was definitely beautiful but it had sliding windows that opened above the bed. When these were closed the person on the toilet could see the person sitting on the bed through the 1-2 inch gap at the bottom. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay - the parking is pricy but what you would expect in a city. I did notice the lack of a bellman. I'm not sure if they were busy? Anyway, we had a very nice visit and I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice time

reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms at the Intercontinental, Boston in July 07 for my husband and I and for my parents. From check-in to check-out, the stay could not have been better. All the staff we met with were professional, accommodating and friendly, from the reception desk to the spa.
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.text: I had booked a harbour-view room for my parents and it was perfect. Very spacious with two queen beds, with the whole back wall floor to ceiling windows overlooking the river, across to the children's museum. My husband's and my room was slightly smaller with a king sized bed, chaise longue, and separate desk area. Even though we did not request a view with our room, we had a partial river view which was lovely.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.text: The bathrooms were amazing. In our room, we had a sliding partition between the bathroom to the bedroom so we could chat to each other while we are taking a bath! The bathroom in my parent's room did not have this feature, which was fine for them. The bathrooms had separate walk-in showers which was great too. Plush robes. Nice toiletries.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms were gorgeous and back esplanade such a nice retreat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their turn-down service included filling our ice bucket and leaving a small chocolate for us, which I thought was a nice touch.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

likes.disliked: — No coffee shop in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, clean hotel. Great location. Took a water taxi from Logan, a quick 5 minute ride for $10. Clean rooms, nice tub and seperate shower. Great restaurants and bar in hotel too.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — bathroom has doors that open by tub to look into bedroom area, took away from toilet privacy

reviews.title: Good, not great
reviews.text: We recently stayed for a long weekend at the Intercontinental Boston. It is a good, very modern business hotel. However, it is not up to the standard of other five star hotels in Boston and other major cities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's design is well done, open, modern and bright. The lobby is a bit stark. Rooms are well done. Bathrooms very nice. Beds not that comfortable, surprisingly. We were upgraded to a suite and it was huge, with windows that went on forever. Very nicely done, but not ultra luxe, frankly. Good views to the canal and the airport in the distance. We could have lived in there for a week, easily.
reviews.title: Perfect base for visiting Boston

likes.liked: — nice classy hotel to make an occasion of a holiday
likes.disliked: — the stern 5 minute warning by the bell hop for parking to collect bags from room

reviews.text: Yet, it isn't a "warm and friendly" kind of property. The service is somewhat distant. I guess that is fine for a business traveler, perhaps, but, I think if you wanted to you could check in, spend a couple of days, and check out, and have no contact with any hotel employee, except maybe for the on the ball bellmen. The check in desk was crowded and the concierges seemed a bit inexperienced. And, at the rates they charge there was no turn down service at night. While you might think that is no big deal, it should be. When we asked about it on check out we were told, "it is available on request." In a five star city hotel such service is standard, not on request.
reviews.title: Questionable Experience

reviews.text: All in all it is a solid choice, with a good location for touring and modern bright rooms. Yet it is not super luxe if that is what you are looking for. Of course, Boston was great.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the intercontinental for 3 nights last week, the room was clean and fresh, the bathroom is spectacular and was sparkling clean. Even if we used Priceline, we were given a corner room on the 6th floor with a view of the river. The ladies at the front desk and the concierge were really knowledgeable and helpful. The only negatives are the high cost of parking (40$/day) and that we waited a long time for the bellman the morning we left.The hotel is situated one block from the South Station, another plus.
reviews.title: Loved the intercontinental

reviews.text: Another great deal from Hotwire got us this room for about $210 per night (incl. tax). We knew going in that the parking would be stiff, so I posted a query here on Tripadvisor and was given some great advice. Parked the rental car a few stops down the subway line in Quincy and took the train back to the station just two blocks from the hotel. Saved $35/night and parking was in a secure, monitored structure in a nice area.
reviews.title: The Intercontinental; Great home base for visit to Boston

likes.disliked: — The exorbitant charges for use of the luxurious touches everywhere

reviews.text: The hotel was spectacular. As this was our first stop in a 2 week vacation driving around Massachusetts and New York, it made for a very hard act to follow. The lobby area is simple but very elegant, the valet attendants and bellmen were very courteous. The front desk clerk made arrangements to place us in a quiet corner of the 8th floor when I mentioned that we had a couple of very light sleepers in our group.
reviews.title: Great Room, Close to T station, Walk to North End and Downtown

reviews.text: The room was clean, beautifully furnished, and huge. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the sheets, pillows, linens, and towels were all of superior quality. Over the four days we were at the Intercontinental we called down for extra towels a few times and the housekeeping staff responded immediately.
reviews.title: Certainly not a home away from home...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room service charges were standard for a premium hotel in the city, so we passed on room service. We did avail ourselves of the exercise room/pool area and spa a few times during our stay, and found these to be first rate. The mens spa included a large steam room, and the locker room was very upscale. The indoor pool (and the room in which it resided) were beautiful. Very relaxing.
reviews.title: Really Nice & Comfortable Room
intercontintental Boston just OUTSTANDING.
reviews.text: I took my family to Boston to celebrate two special birthdays,we picked the intercontinental with Virgin Atlantic airways.It was a wise choice in every way.The size of the bedroom,and the bathroom were very large.The waterfront is a good location as its close to the tube underground,and convenient for walking to the centre.The restaurant was good and not overly expensive by Boston prices.The staff were excellent,and all very helpfull.I would certainly stay there again.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel
reviews.text: New, spacious hotel on Atlantic Avenue about 200 yards from South Station. Rooms were large and well laid-out; the bathroom alone was bigger than the room in many other hotels I've stayed at. I got a Hotwire deal otherwise it would have been unaffordable! Only downside: there's a French-Provencale restaurant and room service menu of Boston specialities, but no in-house coffee shop or lighter dining, which makes the place more like a very upmarket 3-star hotel than the 5-star it aspires to be.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here for one evening during a USA vacation. Every aspect of the stay at this hotel was perfect. All the staff we encountered were amazingly courteous and friendly. I chose this hotel as a Priority Club Ambassador and I was given a corner room with a sea view.

reviews.title: Exceptionally good hotel
reviews.text: I loved the room. I opened the door to a long wide corridor, at the end turned right and there was the entry to the bathroom on the left. And then opening into a very large bedroom replete with a good sized king bed, chaise lounge, very large armchair and footstool, desk area and console with a 32 inch (I think) flat screen TV. It really was a delight!

reviews.title: Travelers be warned
reviews.text: Above the bed were two sliding doors which opened a “hatch” between the bedroom and the bathroom so (I presume) one could soak in the bath and watch TV but something I have never come across before!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I concluded our east cost trip with a stay in Boston @ the Intercontinental Boston. We loved the room with a king size bed, ample space and a wonderful bathroom. The atmosphere was very relaxing and was very quiet as we did not hear any of our neighbour with the exception of the odd firetruck pulling one night.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

reviews.text: The gym was fantastic! Brand new equipment with a self-contained tv on the treadmills and the elliptical machine.
reviews.title: Brand new luxury hotel that lives up to expectations from Intercontinental

likes.disliked: — The little water issue and they could have changed the dirty glasses

reviews.text: The only complaint that i have is not the hotel but of the area itself. In the evening, there isn't much in terms of food or even "activity". We would have preferred staying in the Copley Square area where there is more life and more restaurants that are opened later in the evening.
reviews.title: Great deal for Priceline--but request a Harbor View!!!

reviews.text: Other than that...the location of the hotel is very convenient to the subway but we didn't use the subway at all during our stay. We walked through the "tourist" sites all on one day going from Fanueil Square (10 min away from hotel) all the way to Copley Square and Newburry Street and back to the hotel.
reviews.title: surprisingly good for a chain hotel

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay and i'll definitely go back for the hotel but will need to think about the area as one of the decision makers for next time.
reviews.title: Great Priceline Win!

reviews.text: I asked for the manager, and he insisted that despite what the our reservation paper said, I had to pay for the additional night because it was their policy... even though my paper said otherwise. He was very rude and did not offer an apology. On 8/23/2007, while checking out, I tried to talk to the manager again about the reservations being messed up. He told us there was nothing he could do about the mistake they made on my reservation. Then he told me that he "remembered" that my reservation different check in date than was actually on my confirmation sheet; that it was my fault because I was stupid and couldn't read our confirmation paper.
reviews.title: Almost Everything a First Class Hotel Should Be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the hotel turned out to be a mistake because this hotel did not live up to it's four star potential. One design flaw with the hotel there is a panel of frosted glass over the top of the bed, which opens up to show a panorama the toilet and shower. This was annoying for two reasons: 1. a small piece of glass does not provide the same privacy that a wall would if you are using the bathroom, and 2. if someone uses the bathroom at night, the whole bedroom is lit up.
reviews.title: Awesome bed, Great Doorman, Dont touch the mini fridge!
A nice luxury hotel.
reviews.text: The list of the following reasons are the problems we had with our room.

The Intercontinental in Boston is at a suburb location -- close to train systems and the center of town. Lovely views and well-appointed rooms. Service on the weekend we stayed was spotty. On September 20 (a Saturday night) late night room service was punctual and the food excellent. Retrieval of the mess took a while. When we made a toiletry request at 11:00 PM, we were told that there was a 7-11 down the block.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere, low on business service on weekends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On September 21, the Business Center, which was supposed to open, was closed, and remained closed even after we went to breakfast at Miel and returned at 9:00. The concierge tried to accomodate us, but was clearly frustrated that no one was available to help us. As business travellers, it was important that we be able to use the business center in light of the financial happenings of the week, even on a Sunday.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

likes.liked: — Decor, location, overall feel to hotel

reviews.text: Overall, the experience was very nice. It would have been nicer if it were not a working stay.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: The InterContinental is a great hotel - I love the modern decor and the lobby is spacious and welcoming. The location is also great - walking distance to South Station as well as restaurants and bars. We probably could have walked to the North End, but it being December it was freezing!!! I loved the bar in the middle of the lobby (named Champagne something). Our room as excellent - well appointed and the bathroom was amazing! It had a huge jacuzzi tub and had that spa-like quality to it. I would definitely stay here again next time I am in Boston.
reviews.title: Nice location; poor value

reviews.text: Booked as part of the virgin fly drive and what a great start to the holiday. Great location, on the waterfront. Boston's shopping centre, park, aquarium etc are all within walking distance. room was stunning. Food great and service excellent. It's not cheap, but then this is Boston! Just a shame the rest of the hotels virgin picked for us (superior package) weren't up to this standard.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I am a Platinum member, I all do is travel for business, which means that I am clear and understand true customer service and quality. My cousin and I choose to celebrate my birthday in Boston, but I was very surprised at the service and staff demeanor towards the guest.
reviews.title: Overally Disappointed!

reviews.text: The rooms were great and housekeeping staff was amazing!
reviews.title: Poor Hospitality

reviews.text: The restaurants are overly priced and the food was not great at all. The management seemed bothered and did not care to resolve issues. I was charged a portion on my credit card of someone else’s bill, which the manager promised would remove; needless to say I am still disputing the charge.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst part of the stay was when a waiter explained that Boston and the Intercontinental was deceiving and was not a very multiracial and diverse as it seems or promotes. He then proceeded to explain that there were not many guest of diverse backgrounds staying as guest, they were treating us like we should have been the maids.
reviews.title: Great stay! Great location

reviews.text: Overall, was shocked by the statement but surely agreed in the end with his comment.
reviews.title: Superb hotel!
Unseasoned Travellers Will Love This Intercontinental Hotel!
reviews.text: I just returned from a 3 night stay at this Intercontinental.

reviews.title: Great location!!
reviews.text: First, the good points:

reviews.title: Loved It!
reviews.text: - Nice locale - close to the Financial District.

reviews.title: property awesome, details still need work
reviews.text: - New hotel - large room, clean.

reviews.title: good conference facilities and food
reviews.text: - Modern design - like a typical Westin or Marriot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here over Christmas and it was a great choice! The hotel is luxurious in every sense of the word. From the marble lobby to the granite bathroom, and jacuzzi-like bathtub, to the doorman, it deserves every one of its Four Diamonds.
reviews.title: Beautiful and luxurious

reviews.text: We found the service to be wonderful. The receptionist at check-in was very friendly and helpful, the doorman allowed us to park our car out front while we took our bags upstairs. And when I needed salt at 10:30pm, room service graciously had it sent up to our room within 60 seconds.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The only drawback I can think of is the size of the rooms and the mini-fridge. We got a standard room which basically fit a bed, long dresser, desk and 2 night tables. There wasn't too much space (drawers) to put our stuff. We had food to put in the mini-fridge, but it was already filled with snacks that we'd have to pay for if we moved them. We managed to squeeze in 2 yogurts and a water bottle. Also we officially got a water-view room, but in actuality it's a view of the other part of the Intercontinental, and if you squeeze all the way to the left, you can catch a glimpse of some water.
reviews.title: Average and lacking attention to details!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym is huge and better-equipped than any gym I've been to. We didn't actually visit the pool, but from the gym you can see it's clean and modern, and a nice size for swimming laps. The gym and pool are surrounded by glass, so you won't get much privacy.
reviews.title: My favorite place in Boston

reviews.text: Parking: With parking $40/day, you can park at 75 State Street or Central Parking a few blocks away (4 min walk) for half the price.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay in Boston

reviews.text: Two of my children used the pool and loved it. I liked the fact that the pool was shallow. I worked out in the fitness facility and would work out in all hotels I stay in if they were like the Intercontinental Hotel. I watched t.v. on my treadmill as I ran and bottled water was available.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel at Priceline Rates!

likes.liked: — Style, decor, room size, hotel location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate breakfast in the restaurant on Sunday morning. Big mistake and very pricey. Our tab for 6 (including 2 children was $212.00). Service was not friendly or prompt nor was the food that good. Plus an 18% gratuity was added.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay at great price

likes.disliked: — poor sound proofing of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed for two nights over labor day weekend. Booked hotel through priceline and got a $125 a night rate which was excellent compared to other properties. Great room, huge bathroom with both tub and shower. Staff were professional and friendly and enjoyed our stay. We found location to be fine, only a short walk to most attractions and close to the subway. Gym and pool were incredible.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — great hotel at great price, quiet room
likes.disliked: — made us wait till three to check in, I believe because we booked through priceline.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive from Logan, a short 8 minute drive, although with airport fees, the fare ends up being about $22, you are greeted by a wonderful staff in a hotel that meets all expectations.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: There is nothing bad about this hotel. Great rooms, comfortable beds, large bathrooms, even in the standard rooms, and a nice gym.
reviews.title: Great facility - rude staff

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Intercontinental Hotel. The room I had was quite nice and was just as the photos showed. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom huge. I liked the in-room safe that fit my 15" laptop computer. The desk was very nice in that the plugs and modem connections popped out of the desk. The room lighting was very thoughtful, including the mood lighting in the panels to the sides of the bed, the motion sensitive lighting and the reading lamps, all of which were accessible from the bed. One pet peeve, the cordless phone near the bed did not work.
reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness center was also very nice with free bottled water, which I was able to take with me to my room rather than use the mini-bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

likes.disliked: — prices of bar and mini bar

reviews.text: We have visited Boston several times and in the past always stayed near the Boston Common. We decided to try something different this time and went with the Intercontinental. As others have mentioned, South Station and the Silver Line are just minutes from the hotel, so you can get anywhere you want to go from there. Also, a few more blocks in the other direction is the Aquarium and that Subway stop also. BTW, I highly recommend checking out the Aquarium, it was beautiful and fascinating.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Intercontinental, loved the harbor view.

likes.liked: — room design and comfort, amenities, convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was accomplished in minutes and they didn't even bat an eye that we were early, even though the hotel was booked solid for the weekend. I really appreciated that, and I was thrilled when I saw our harbor view room, the windows are floor to ceiling so as to take advantage of the lovely vista. I liked everything about the room and I felt it was extremely well thought out and executed. It was very spacious, lots of storage, very nice lighting, big flat screen TV, quite comfortable and relaxing. And the bathroom was great also, huge, with a separate, deep soaking tub and a terrific shower with awesome water pressure and a handheld shower head as well as the overhead one. And the bath products! I am really picky about them and always bring my own organic stuff but the J. Floris products were just fantastic- very luxurious and natural, they are even stamped with a "use by" date. The body lotion was especially nice. The bed and bedding were wonderful also.
reviews.title: Loved the intercontinental
OK, but they nickel and dime you to death
reviews.text: We enjoyed the bar and the restaurant and were not disappointed in the quality of the food and drinks. Of course you never expect bargain prices but you do hope to at least get your money's worth and we felt we did. Especially when we had breakfast on the outside terrace, overlooking the water.
All in all, definitely a five star experience and we will happily return.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in August 08. It is a great hotel; it is very clean, and it is at a great location. Located about a block from the South Station, a 10 minute walk to Fanueil Hall and china town. The only complaint I have is that the service is just ok for a luxory hotel. The staff are a bit surly, I asked for all of the surrounding attractions brochure at the concierge desk and the woman wouldn't give it me! She state that I need to give her the specific attractions or tell her what I like to do. I mean, come on, its a luxory hotel, and you couldn't just take a brochure from each of the attraction that is on the shelf and hand it to me? Plus, the room service people did not replenish everyday things, like the Q tips, and never changed out the broken phone or the broken hair dryer that I requested. They did bring a great coffee maker for the room. Overall it was a good experience and I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Love the hotel location

reviews.text: I stayed for five nights and can't fault the hotel. Fantastic rooms and friendly/helpful staff. In a great location for the financial district and within walking distance to all the main sights. I actually felt sad when I left!!
reviews.title: Had a great time....

reviews.text: This Hotel is absolutely AMAZING. A great deluxe Hotel. Room was amazing, comfortable and big. Bathroom with both tub and shower. Conveniently located close to South station and the Financial district of Boston (close to the main attractions).
reviews.title: absolutely AWESOME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: loved the Rumbar and the sushi restaurant!!
reviews.title: Luxury on the waterfront

reviews.text: Staff was nice and service excellent.
reviews.title: Perfect Boston location

reviews.text: Wonderful location, great service, beautiful view of the river, ocean and city. Within walking distance of just about everything. Great restaurants close by.
reviews.title: Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for 3 nights in Sept on our arrival the incompetant doorman failed to get all our bags from the trunk of the taxi and then allowed the taxi to leave the hotel. The bag that he left in the trunk contained our money,passports and various other items.The doormans first lie was that most things left in taxis were returned.we never got our bag back.Don't complain to management they will state that it wasn't their fault.Because of the incompetant doorman we had to fly to New York to replace our passports at our expense.You will not get an apology from the management remember it was your fault you allowed the members of his staff to get your bags from the taxi. this is one Hotel we will never say at again. The only person who went the extra mile to help us in every way possible was Mr Luis Branco the concierge he was exceptional and withuot his help i don't know how we would have coped.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.text: Stayed at the Intercontinental for a business trip. The room was beautiful. Modern with great features. Shower was exceptional. Bed very comfortable, and nice sized flat screen TV. The hotels location was great. Close to plenty of restaurants and the Freedom Trail. Staff was very helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had been on the road 3 weeks, with 2 more to go and finally had a free Sunday. I flew my wife up from Alabama to have a romantic night and this hotel worked out perfectly. We were quickly greeted by a nice valet, who helped us with our bags up to the Front Desk. The Desk agent was nice and upgraded me to a Harborview room being a Plat Priority club member. The same valet brought my bags up to my room. When we walked in we were shocked. Huge, Huge!! Clean room. Massive King size bed and a bathroom that looked like it was something from a Spa. The room was well appointed with a fully stocked Mini Bar, K Cup machine and bath robes. Great bed and good TV selection. We walked downstairs to start to go explore the city when we were stopped by a very nice concierge. Who offered us a great map of Boston, and good eating recommendations, and even gave us an umbrella to use because it was drizzling out. When we got back( 1am) the Front Desk was still fully staffed and very welcoming. We went down to Breakfast and although very expensive the omelets were to die for. This is truly a gem of the Holiday Inn brand and would never hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: I needed this....

reviews.text: Thanks InterContinental Boston for making my one day off memorable.

description: Standing on the very spot where a late-night tea party ignited the American Revolution, InterContinental Boston puts you at the heart of history in ultra-modern style. Adjacent to the Financial District, our gleaming glass towers are a short walk from Faneuil Hall, Back Bay, Chinatown, Beacon Hill and the Boston Convention & Exhibition Center.
